description: This file defines the ApiClient class, which serves as a wrapper for HTTP network requests in a Flutter application. It manages base URLs based on request paths, adds headers, handles request logging, and provides methods for GET and POST requests with JSON processing.

classes.name: ApiClient
classes.description: A class that wraps HTTP client operations, providing methods for GET and POST requests with configurable base URLs, headers, and logging.

methods.name: ApiClient
methods.description: Constructor initializing the ApiClient with optional custom HTTP client.

methods.name: _defaultHeaders
methods.description: Generates default headers, including content type and optional authorization token.

methods.name: _isAuthPath
methods.description: Determines if a given path is an authentication-related path.

methods.name: _pickBaseUrl
methods.description: Selects the appropriate base URL based on the request path.

methods.name: _buildUri
methods.description: Constructs a complete Uri object for the request, including query parameters.

methods.name: _wrap
methods.description: Sends the HTTP request, with optional logging and method-specific handling.

methods.name: getList
methods.description: Performs a GET request and returns a list decoded from JSON response.

methods.name: postJson
methods.description: Performs a POST request with JSON payload and returns the decoded response map.
